title: REVIEW --- Play: News Quiz
text:
B. MTM Enterprises

C. Topple Productions

D. Harpo Productions

---

2. Don Juan van de Donkhoeve was in the news. Why?

A. He'll star in a remake of Mr. Ed.

B. His DNA was used to make the first vat-grown horsemeat.

C. He does the jumping for Jessica Springsteen in the Olympics.

D. He's piled up more stud fees than any other horse.

---

3. Which state is emerging as a hotspot in the battle over phasing out natural gas for home cooking and heating?

A. Indiana

B. Ohio

C. Kentucky

D. Massachusetts

---

4. What does Kim Jong Un want before he'll restart nuclear talks with the U.S.?

A. Refined fuel

B. Refined suits

C. Refined liquor

D. All of the above

--

5. A pricey gift from the government of Japan to then Secretary of State Mike Pompeo is missing. What was it?

A. A $5,800 bottle of Japanese whiskey

B. A $12,500 tea service

C. A $16,300 hand painted silk kimono

D. A priceless pair of Edo-era whalebone chopsticks

---

6. Facebook disabled a study of political ads on its social media platform. Where was the research being done?

A. City University of New York

B. New York University

C. New York Institute of Technology

D. New York College of Podiatric Medicine

---

7. Who's the world's new top chip maker by second-quarter revenue?

A. Intel

B. Samsung

C. Qualcomm

D. Taiwan Semiconductor

---

8. Grill maker Weber made financial headlines. How?

A. It went public

B. It went private

C. It became a meme stock

D. It was raked over the coals by climate activists

---

9. Who will soon be outfitted with body cameras?

A. Baristas

B. A handful of FBI agents

C. Some border patrol agents

D. Many postal inspectors

---

ANSWERS

1. A

2. C

3. D

4. D

5. A

6. B

7. B

8. A

9. C
